page.title: 02FARMING IN THE PEWSEY VALE
page.content: Farms in the area tend to be quite large, from 500-2000 acres(200-800 hectares). Over the past ten years they have tended to move more and more towards cereal productions. Though most farms still rear some cattle for beef, the French Limousin and Charolais breeds have replaced the more traditional Hereford and Friesian used by former dairy farmers. The generous payments from the E.E.C. in 1983/84 to dairy farmers to end milk production has seen the disappearance of milking herds from 6 farms to 1. Two farms have reintroduced some sheep rearing as the price of lambs has become more attractive. The use of bigger and bigger machines to cope with the increased cereal production has caused farmers to remove hedges to create larger fields.
